snippet: Growth is still weak, at a 1.1 percent annualized rate, but indicates that the bloc is well beyond the year-and-a-half recession that ended last year.
abstract: Official report shows Euro zone economy grew slightly faster than expected in final three months of 2013, with Germany and France leading upturn; growth is still weak, at 1.1 percent annualized rate, but indicates that bloc is well beyond year-and-a-half recession.

byline.contributor: Nicola Clark contributed reporting from Paris, and Jack Ewing and Stanley Reed from London.

lead_paragraph: Growth is still weak, at a 1.1 percent annualized rate, but indicates that the bloc is well beyond the year-and-a-half recession that ended last year.

headline.main: France and Germany Lead Euro Zone to Higher Growth
headline.print_headline: France and Germany Lead Euro Zone to Higher Growth Than Expected
